page.title: 12EMPLOYMENT IN STOCKTON.
page.content: FROM A SURVEY 62.8% OF PEOPLE OVER 16 YEARS OF AGE WERE EMPLOYED(MALES 76.7%,FEMALES 46%). IN ALL 65.4% WORKED IN THE PARISH,1.9% WORKED ELSEWHERE,O.9% UNEMPLOYED AND 3O.9% RETIRED.NEARLY 6 IN 1O OF HOUSEHOLDS WERE HEADED BY MALES EMPLOYED IN FARMING OR AS APLEY ESTATE WORKERS.BUT AGRICULTURAL EMPLOYMENT IS FALLING COMPARED WITH THE NUMBERS EMPLOYED IN THE 195OS. OF THE 1.9% EMPLOYED ELSEWHERE THE MAJORITY WERE IN THE PROFESSIONAL CLASSES EG. TOWN PLANNER,RESEARCH WORKER,TEACHERS, OTHERS BEING BANK CLERKS, SHOP WORKERS & CAR MECHANICS. IT IS INCREASINGLY EVIDENT THAT THE YOUNGER NORTON RESIDENTS WILL HAVE TO WORK OUTSIDE THE AREA THUS INVOLVING THEM IN A DAILY JOURNEY TO WORK.
